title: M1L1: Hello, World!
description: Welcome to Python! In this first lesson, we'll write our first Python program.
content:
Python is a powerful, easy-to-learn programming language. Let's start with the traditional first program that every programmer writes: Hello, World!

The print() function

In Python, we use the print() function to display text on the screen. Here's how it works:

  • Type print()
  • Put your text inside quotes within the parentheses
  • Run the code to see the output

Try it yourself!

Modify the code below to print your own message:
starterCode:
# This is a comment - it won't run
# Comments start with the # symbol

# Let's print Hello, World!
print("Hello, World!")

# Try adding your own print statement below:
solution:
print("Hello, World!")
print("Welcome to Python!")
print("I'm learning to code!")
hints: Remember to put your text inside quotes
Each print() statement will display on a new line
You can use either single quotes ('') or double quotes ("")
